products.title: PHONE (1)
products.description: Designed with instinct, to bring joy back to the everyday. Through the Glyph Interface, a perfected OS and exceptional dual camera. All startlingly fast.

products.title: EAR (1)
products.description: Ultra light at 4.7g. Powerful 11.6mm speaker driver. Sound by Teenage Engineering. Active Noise Cancellation. Up to 34 hours of listening.

products.title: EAR (STICK)
products.description: Tech you can’t feel. Custom 12.6 mm dynamic driver. Clear Voice Technology. Press controls. Up to 29 hrs of listening time.

products.title: PHONE (2)
products.description: New Glyph Interface. 50 MP dual rear camera + 32 MP front camera. 6.7” LTPO OLED display. Snapdragon® 8+ Gen 1.

products.title: EVERYTHING WATER
products.description: It's just water. But it's Everything. Sourced from the tears of our competitors. pH balanced for maximum hydration and ego.

products.title: EVERYTHING AIR
products.description: The ultimate minimalist product. You can't see it, but you need it. Packaged in a vacuum-sealed jar for freshness.

products.title: EVERYTHING PET
products.description: It does nothing. It is a rock. But it is an Everything Rock. Compatible with gravity.

products.title: EVERYTHING NOTHING
products.description: We removed everything. The screen, the battery, the case. You get literally nothing. The ultimate status symbol.
features: Infinite Battery Life (because it doesn't exist)

products.title: EVERYTHING BRICK
products.description: It's a brick. Red. Heavy. Useful for building things or holding doors open. The foundation of civilization, now in your pocket (if you have big pockets).

products.title: EVERYTHING SUIT
products.description: A onesie made entirely of fiber optic cables. Light up the room, literally. Warning: Do not bend knees more than 45 degrees.

posts.title: Why Everything?
posts.excerpt: In a world of nothing, we chose everything. Here is why.
posts.content: We looked at the market and saw a void. A void of minimalism that had gone too far. People were buying phones that did nothing. Earbuds that played nothing. We decided to change that. We decided to give people EVERYTHING. Every feature, every pixel, every possible atom of technology crammed into a single device. Because you deserve it all.

posts.title: The Dot Matrix Revolution
posts.excerpt: Why we chose the most legible font in history.
posts.content: Dots. They are the building blocks of the universe. Atoms are dots. Planets are dots (from far away). So why shouldn't our font be dots? It's not just a stylistic choice; it's a philosophical one. By breaking down language into points, we remind you that everything is connected, yet distinct. Also, it looks cool.

posts.title: Water is Wet. Discuss.
posts.excerpt: A deep dive into the moisture of our new product.
posts.content: We released Everything Water. People asked, 'Is it wet?' We convened a board meeting. We hired scientists. We touched it. The conclusion? Yes. It is wet. But is it *too* wet? That is for you to decide. Experience hydration like never before. It's not just water; it's liquid existence.

posts.title: Why We Hate Colors
posts.excerpt: Red is okay. Everything else is a distraction.
posts.content: Look around you. The world is chaotic. Too many colors. Blue, Green, Yellow. Disgusting. We believe in purity. Black. White. And Red (because it looks dangerous). By removing color, we remove distraction. We allow you to focus on the form, the function, the nothingness. You're welcome.

posts.title: The Art of Doing Nothing
posts.excerpt: Productivity is overrated. We explore the benefits of staring at a wall for 8 hours.
posts.content: In a world that demands constant output, we propose a radical alternative: zero output. Our new 'Everything Nothing' product is the embodiment of this philosophy. It doesn't do anything, so you don't have to either.
posts.author: Zen Master

posts.title: Why Squares Are Better Than Circles
posts.excerpt: Circles are pointless. Squares have four points. The math is simple.
posts.content: We have redesigned the wheel. It is now square. It is less efficient, but it looks much better in a grid layout. Form over function. Always.
posts.author: Geometry Fan

posts.title: The History of the Circle
posts.excerpt: A 5,000-word essay on why we abandoned it.
posts.content: The circle. A shape with no beginning and no end. Sounds exhausting, right? We prefer shapes that end. Like lines. And squares. We traced the history of the circle from the invention of the wheel to the invention of the donut. Our conclusion? It's round. And we don't like it.
posts.author: Shape Historian

posts.title: We Bought a Planet
posts.excerpt: Announcing the acquisition of Mars (pending regulatory approval).
posts.content: We needed more space for our warehouses. So we bought a planet. It's red, which fits our brand. We plan to turn it into the world's largest distribution center. Shipping times may vary (6-8 months).
posts.author: Elon M. (Not that one)

posts.title: Interview with a Pixel
posts.excerpt: We sat down with a single pixel to ask it about its life purpose.
posts.content:
Interviewer: So, you're a pixel. What do you do?

Pixel: I turn on. I turn off. Sometimes I'm red. Sometimes I'm blue. Mostly I just wait for the user to scroll past me.

Interviewer: Do you feel important?

Pixel: I am 1/2,073,600th of a 1080p screen. Without me, the image is incomplete. But with me, nobody notices. It is a lonely existence. But it is honest work.
posts.author: Tech Journalist
